description: png ObjectiveTo detect and classify the severity of prostate cancer on images of prostate tissue samples. Prostate cancer begins when cells in the prostate gland start to grow out of control. Visualizing Image and Mask SamplesLet s have a quick first look at the differences between the data providers in regards to the original images and the masks. it might be good idea to use these test cases for validation. Valid values are 0 backgound non tissue or unknown 1 benign tissue stroma and epithelium combined 2 cancerous tissue stroma and epithelium combined few images and associated masks for samples with Gleason Score 5 5 Parse all images for train data to extract image characteristics Overlaying masks on the slides As the masks have the same dimension as the slides we can overlay the masks on the tissue to directly see which areas are cancerous. The prostate is below the bladder and in front of the rectum. All the Karolinska images in the training data is graded by the same pathologist. For further analysis we will drop the 100 images without a mask. Differences Between Data ProvidersThey used different scanners with slightly different maximu microscope resolutions and worked with different pathologists for labeling their images. png attachment image. However the system suffers from significant inter observer variability between pathologists limiting its usefulness for individual patients. However for the test set we used several pathologists who each labeled the images using ISUP not Gleason and derived a consensus label. The mislabeled image was one of the those images but was later moved to the training set. To do this we load both the mask and the biopsy and merge them using PIL. Cancerous epithelium Gleason 4 5.
